French justice stalls as evidence of police violence during 2023 protest is overlooked
subhead: The early November release of troubling video footage by Mediapart and 'Libération,' showing gendarmes confronting environmental activists protesting against mega-reservoirs in March 2023, has highlighted the legal system's inadequate response.

subhead: An advocacy group has called on France's highest administrative court to recognize that France is not doing enough to fight climate change, given its historical responsibility and financial capacity.

title: Ivorian youth are swept up in a retro craze
subhead: Music and fashion from the 1960s and 1970s, once symbols of Côte d'Ivoire's post-independence economic and cultural boom, are experiencing an unexpected resurgence in popularity.

title: Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands pull out of 2026 Eurovision over Israel's participation
subhead: The organizers of next year's Eurovision Song Contest announced they were allowing Israel to compete on Thursday, drawing quick announcements of withdrawals from European countries critical of the Israeli offensive in Gaza.

title: Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
subhead: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.

PFAS: France's tap water is widely polluted with TFA, the most common 'forever chemical'
subhead: A French state health agency analyzed over 600 samples of drinking water. 92% of them contained traces of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA), the smallest PFAS molecule, which is suspected to be toxic.

title: Zelensky without Yermak: The story of a split at the top of Ukraine
subhead: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.

title: 'I am as afraid of the rain as I was of the war': How severe weather compounds the suffering of displaced Gazans
subhead: Men, women and children are facing their third winter in a territory where more than 80% of infrastructure has been destroyed, including drainage networks and water evacuation and sanitation systems.
